msContents.summary: I) Gadla Samāʿtāt, Vitae of Saints and Martyrs (fols. 1ra-55vb) [cp. Orient 691 (15th cent.) fols. 1a-218b (WrBriMus 163-63, no. 255); Orient 686, fol. 58a-b (WrBriMus 167, no. 257/14); EMML no. 1833 (14th cent.) fols. 1a-170b (EMML V, 302-5)] I-1) Manifestation of the Prophet Habakkuk (ʿƎnbaqom) at Qärṭäsa (for the 3rd of Ḫǝdār) (fols. 1ra-11va, 18ra-vb, 20ra-vb, 43ra-vb), incomplete [s. C. CONTI ROSSINI, “La leggenda di Habacuch nella versione etiopica”, in: Scritti etiopici raccolti da C. Conti Rossini, Roma 1945, 17-40] I-2) Commemoration of Eleazar (ʾƎlʿazar) the son of Aron (for the 3rd of Ḫǝdār) (fol. 11va-b) I-3) Homily by Theophilus of Alexandria on the blessed Virgin Mary for the 6th of Ḫǝdār (fols. 11vb-17vb, 19ra-31vb), incomplete [cp. C. CONTI ROSSINI, “Il discorso su monte Coscam attribuito a Teofilo d’Alessandria nella versione etiopica”, RANLmor ser. 5, 21, 1912, 395-471; CANT no. 56] I-4) Taʾāmra Giyorgis “Miracles of George”: Introduction and 4 miracles (for the 7th of Ḫǝdār) (fols. 33ra-40vb), incomplete I-5) Homily on the Archangel Michael by Severus the patriarch of Antioch (for the 12th of Ḫǝdār) (fols. 41ra-vb, 55ra-va), incomplete I-6) Homily on the 24 Elders (Heavenly Priests) by Severus the Patriarch of Antioch, “an admonition to priests” (for the 24th of Ḫǝdār) (fols. 42ra-vb, 45ra-46vb, 48ra-b, 56ra-vb), incomplete I-7) Martyrdom of Jacob the Persian (Yāʿqob Gǝmud) (for the 27th of Ḫǝdār) (fol. 48rb-vb), incomplete I-8) Passio of Cosmas and Damianus (for the 22nd of Ḫǝdār) (fols. 49ra-vb, 51ra-54vb), incomplete I-9) History of ʾAskänafǝr (ʾAksänafǝr) a judge of Rome written by Epiphanius of Cyprus (for the 13th of Ḫǝdār) (fols. 50ra-vb, 55va-b), incomplete. Texts on fols. 44 and 47 have not been identified.

msItem.note: The content of the Ms. appears quite similar to that of and Ms. BritLib., Orient 691 (15th cent., WrBriMus. n. 255).

list.item: Because of the poor condition of the Ms. it is not possible to determine the exact number of the quires.

supportDesc.condition: Both boards and sewing are missing. Some 60% of the fols. are lost, the remaining fols. are in disorder. The fols. are affected by humidity and damaged by rodents. Parts of the text are lost, parts are not readable. Because of the poor condition it is not possible to determine exactly the number and the structure of the quires.

layout.ab: Pricking and ruling are partly visible.
The upper line is written below the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
with extensive decoration at the bottom, used as a macro-caesura

handDesc.handNote: The quality of the handwriting remains the same throughout the Ms. Tall and angular letters; the body of several letters is triangular (e.g.: ዐ, ለ, መ); the marker of the sixth order of ጰ is attached to the left side of the main body; the vowel marker of the seventh order of ለ is attached directly at the body of the letter, without the connecting line; the seventh order marker of ተ is attached directly at the crossing stroke of bar; the seventh order of ቀ is directly attached at the loops; the loops of መ are not separated; the numbers in the text headings and notes in the upper margin of the fols. are always written without dashes above and below (but with dashes within the text); the loops of the number two are not separated and have the same width (e.g., 6ra, 11va, etc.).

item.desc: - Notes in the upper margins of some fols. indicating feasts and occassions for readings (by the same hand as the main text): አመ፡ ፮፡ ለኅዳር፡ ምንባ[ብ።]: fol. 11v <…>ር፡ ምንባብ።: fol. 38r አመ፡ ፲፫፡ ምንባብ።: fol. 55v.
